Items.Title: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) called  the Meeting to order.
Roll Call
The Clerk (Mr. Robles) announced the presence of a quorum.
Supplemental Messages & Papers from the Mayor

Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Resolution Number 1022, Resolution disapproving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 050173 PCM (L.U. No. 468).
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto Res. No. 1022 - LU 468 - ULURP, 91st Street, Manhattan (050173PCM)

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Resolution Number 1023, Resolution disapproving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 050175 PSK (L.U. No. 469)
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto Res. No. 1023 - LU 469 - ULURP, 1824 Shore Parkway, Brooklyn (050175PSK)

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Resolution Number 1024, Resolution disapproving the decision of the City Planning Commission on ULURP No. C 050176 PSK (L.U. No. 470)
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto Res. No. 1024 - LU 470 - ULURP, 488 Hamilton Avenue, Brooklyn (050176PSK)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the unincorporated business tax to the general corporation tax with respect to the source of receipts from personal services and the inclusion of rented tangible personal property in the property allocation factor, and making formula allocation the preferred method for taxpayers subject to the unincorporated business tax, and allowing certain existing partnerships to continue to use the books and records allocation  method for a seven-year period; makes technical corrections relating thereto;  and  to repeal certain provisions of such code relating to the unincorporated business pertaining to leveraged buy-out transactions.” A.8434 / S.5568
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Conforming the unicorporated tax to the general corporation tax.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the tax law, the administrative code of the city of New York, chapter 877 of the laws of 1975, chapter 880 of the laws of 1975, chapter 884 of the laws of 1975, and chapter 882 of the laws of 1977, all relating to the imposition of certain taxes in the city of New York, in relation to postponing the expiration of certain tax rates and taxes in the city of New York.” A.8780 / S.5617
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Relating to the imposition of certain taxes in NYC.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to tax credits for eligible businesses that relocate to industrial business zones in the city of New York, the creation of an industrial business zone boundary commission, and the designation, amendment and repeal of such zones.” A.8774 / S.5596
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Industrial business zones.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating contributions to the New York city employees' retirement system, the New York city teachers' retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter two, the fire department pension fund, subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors required to make employer contributions to such retirement systems, and the crediting of special interest and additional interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of supplementary interest on the funds of such retirement systems.” A.8811 / S.5672
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Calculating contributions to NYCERS.

Items.Title: Communication for the Mayor - Mayor's veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 584-A, in relation to the expenditure of payments in lieu of taxes and requiring a monthly report on the collection and use of all such payments to the City of New York.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor' Veto Int 584-A - Expenditure of payments in lieu of taxes and requiring a monthly report on the collection and use of all such payments to NYC.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to limiting assessment increases attributable to additions to or improvements  of certain class two properties in the city of New York.” A.7011-A
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Limiting assessment increases attributable to additions to or improvements  of certain class two properties in NYC. (A.7011-A)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to increasing the combined household income limit for eligibility for a senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) and for a municipal tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens.” A.6590-B / S.5465-A
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Increasing the combined household income limit for eligibility for a senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE)

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend chapter 130 of the laws of 1998 amending the general municipal law relating to temporary investments by local governments, in relation to extending the expiration of the provisions thereof.” A.8779 / S.5382
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Temporary investments by local governments, in relation to extending the expiration of the provisions thereof.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to exempting certain clothing and footwear sales and uses from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed in or by any city having a population of one million or more.” A.8813 / S.5663
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Exempting certain clothing and footwear sales and uses from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed in or by any city having a population of one million or more.

Resolution approving a partial exemption from real property taxes for property located at 920 Metcalf Avenue (Block 3659, Lot 1), the Bronx, pursuant to Section 577 of the Private Housing Finance Law (Preconsidered L.U. No. 507).
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on State and Federal Legislation

Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the unincorporated business tax to the general corporation tax with respect to the source of receipts from personal services and the inclusion of rented tangible personal property in the property allocation factor, and making formula allocation the preferred method for taxpayers subject to the unincorporated business tax, and allowing certain existing partnerships to continue to use the books and records allocation  method for a seven-year period; makes technical corrections relating thereto;  and  to repeal certain provisions of such code relating to the unincorporated business pertaining to leveraged buy-out transactions.” A.8434 / S.5568

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor  -  “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating contributions to the New York city employees' retirement system, the New York city teachers' retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter two, the fire department pension fund, subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors required to make employer contributions to such retirement systems, and the crediting of special interest and additional interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of supplementary interest on the funds of such retirement systems.” A.8811 / S.5672

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Dilan S.1081 and Assembly Member Robinson A.2014, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner George Black, or if he is deceased, to the person or persons who would have inherited said property from him or to their successor in interest, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 1762, Lot No. 62 on tax map for the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: In Rem, George Black, Brooklyn

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1958 and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3866, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of the New York city department of correction for ordinary disability benefits.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to eligibility of uniformed personnel of NYC correction dept. for ordinary disability benefits

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Sampson S.2158, “An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corporation, not withstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785 Lots No.1 and No.75 on the tax map of the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, to reconvey its interest in certain real property, acquired through in rem tax foreclosure, in Brooklyn to Elva McZeal Tenants Association Develoment Fund Corp.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Gordon A.6463, “An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corporation, not withstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785 Lots No.1 and No.75 on the tax map of the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: In rem, Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corp

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S.2706 and Assembly Member Scarborough, A.5541 “AN ACT authorizing its interest in certain real property acquired in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Siraj Wahhaj, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 12332, Lot No. 154 on tax map for the borough of Queens”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: In rem tax foreclose in Queens, Former owner Siraj Wahhaj

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2519, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7243, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs members of the New York City employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, to deputy sheriffs members of NYCERS.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Krueger, S.2522, and Assembly Member Gottfried, A.6535, “AN ACT to authorize the New York city employees’ retirement system to accept an application for a Final Medical Review from Barry Kimmel”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Accept application for final medical review from Barry Kimmel.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5152, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8126, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the education law and the retirement and social security law, in relation to establishing the right of retirees to pay back loans”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishing the right of retirees to pay back loans

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5437, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8245, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty-five year/age fifty-five retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as a mortuary/quality assurance member subject to articles 11 and 15 of the retirement and social security law”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a 25/55 retirement program for members of NYCERS employed as mortuary/quality assurance.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5487, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8314, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of parks in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the parks department in cities with population million or more.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S.1955-A and Assembly Member Seminerio A.3869-A, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of correction in cities having a population of one million or more.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the department of correction.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan and Golden, S.5620, and Assembly Member Wright, A.8723, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to limiting assessment increases attributable to additions to or improvements of certain class two properties in the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Limiting assessment increases attributable to additons or improvements.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4081-A, and Assembly Member Perry, A.1445-A, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the “open driveway act” regarding the environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Open driveway act.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3972, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Pheffer, Seddio and Weisenberg, A.6381, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to the employment of retired NYC police personnel.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senate Committee on Rules, S.5671, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8792, “AN ACT authorizing Lawrence Gerson to file for retroactive membership in Tier 1 of the New York state and local employees’ retirement system”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Tier one retroactive membership for Lawrence Gerson.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2310, and Assembly Member Gianaris, A.8031, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the optional age fifty-five improved benefit retirement program for certain New York city members”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Optional age 55 improved benefit retirement program.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Maltese S. 2516-A and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz A.5273-A, “An Act to amend the general municipal law, in relation to certain impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5457-A, and Assembly Members Clark and Weprin, A.8421-A, “AN ACT to authorize the commissioner of general services to convey certain land in Queens county to the city of New York department of parks and recreation”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Convey certain land in Queens to NYC Dept. of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Krueger, S.5706, and Assembly Member O’Donnell, A.8899, “AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the general corporation, unincorporated business, and banking corporation tax rates”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Reducing the general corp., unincorporated business and banking corp. tax rates.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Maltese and Marchi, S.5750, and Assembly Members McLaughlin, Farrell, Bing, Carrozza and Lavelle A.8896, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year 2006”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Property tax law, in relation to adusted base proportions.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5459-A, and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.8375-A, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to increasing the earned income tax credit against the personal income tax for residents of a city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Increasing earned income tax credit.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5663, and the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.8813, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to exempting certain clothing and footwear sales and uses from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed in or by any city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Exempting certain clothing and footwear sales from taxes.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5465-A, and Assembly Members Wright, Benedetto, Benjamin, Boyland, Lavelle, O’Donnell, Pheffer, Rivera, and Colton, A.6590-B, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to increasing the combined household income limit for eligibility for senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) and for a municipal tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Amend the real property tax law.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3170, and Assembly Member Grannis, A.6483, “AN ACT to amend the highway law, in relation to liability of the state with respect to maintenance and repair of state arterial highways”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Maintenance and repair of state arterial highways.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan and Golden, S.5694, and Assembly Member Weprin, A.8861, “AN ACT to amend the general city law, chapter 772 of the laws of 1966 relating to enabling any city with a population of one million or more to raise tax revenue, and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the relocation and employment assistance program credit for companies in eligible growth industries”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Companies in eligible growth industries.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5382, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8779, “AN ACT to amend chapter 130 of the laws of 1998 amending the general municipal law relating to temporary investments by local governments, in relation to extending the expiration of the provisions thereof”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Temporary investments by local governments, in relation to extending the expiration of the provisions thereof.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Duane, Andrews, Dilan, Hassell-Thompson, Krueger, Montgomery, Oppenheimer, Parker, Sabini, Sampson and Schneiderman, S.5157, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, the administrative code of the city of New York, the retirement and social security law and the education law, in relation to providing special accidental death benefits and accidental death benefits to registered domestic partners of deceased members of the New York city police pension fund, subchapter two, the New York city fire department pension fund, subchapter two, the New York city employees’ retirement system, the New York city teachers’ retirement system and the board of education retirement system of the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Providing special accidental death benefits  and accidental death benefits to registered domestic partners of deceased members of the NYC police pension fund,  subchapter two,  the NYC fire department pension fund.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Heastie, A.4407, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland a portion of real property in the borough of the Bronx and to use such property, as well as property under the jurisdiction of the city of New York department of transportation, for expansion and improvement of the Gun Hill Road subway station, in and around the intersection of White Plains Road and Gun Hill Road in exchange for the dedication of certain other land in the borough of the Bronx for park purposes”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Expansion and improvement of the Gun Hill Road subway station.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5818, and the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.8932, “AN ACT authorizing the leasing of certain parkland and demapping of certain streets for development of a professional baseball stadium and associated facilities in and in the vicinity of Macombs Dam Park and John Mullaly Park in the borough of the Bronx in the city of New York, and to authorize the state to dispose of  certain surplus lands to the city of New  York to provide for new park facilities”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Leasing of certain parkland and demapping of certain streets for development of a professional baseball stadium.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Saland, S.5823, “AN ACT to grant Anthony J. Cuomo performance of duty disability retirement benefits and health insurance coverage, as a result of injuries and disabilities incurred in action while serving in Iraq as a member of the Naval Reserve”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Grant Anthony J. Cuomo performance of duty disability retirement benefits and health insurance coverage.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5828, and Assembly Member Espaillat, A.8915, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to the extension of the top personal income tax rate for incomes in excess of five hundred thousand dollars a year or more and the dedication of such revenue to class size reduction in a city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this SLR be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Income tax rate for incomes in excess of five hundred thousand dollars.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Gordon A.6463, “An Act authorizing the city of New York to reconvey its interest in certain real property acquired by in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Brooklyn to former owner Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corporation, not withstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 3785 Lots No.1 and No.75 on the tax map of the borough of Brooklyn.”
Items.MatterName: In rem, Elva McZeal Tenants Association Development Fund Corp

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Smith, S.2706 and Assembly Member Scarborough, A.5541 “AN ACT authorizing its interest in certain real property acquired in rem tax foreclosure in the borough of Queens to former owner Siraj Wahhaj, notwithstanding expiration of the two year period within which application may be made to the city to release its interest in property thus acquired; Block No. 12332, Lot No. 154 on tax map for the borough of Queens”.
Items.MatterName: In rem tax foreclose in Queens, Former owner Siraj Wahhaj

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2519, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.7243, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to deputy sheriffs members of the New York City employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Amend the retirement and social security law, to deputy sheriffs members of NYCERS.

Items.MatterName: Accept application for final medical review from Barry Kimmel.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5152, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8126, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, the education law and the retirement and social security law, in relation to establishing the right of retirees to pay back loans”.
Items.MatterName: Establishing the right of retirees to pay back loans

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5437, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8245, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a twenty-five year/age fifty-five retirement program for members of the New York city employees’ retirement system employed as a mortuary/quality assurance member subject to articles 11 and 15 of the retirement and social security law”.
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a 25/55 retirement program for members of NYCERS employed as mortuary/quality assurance.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5487, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8314, “AN ACT to amend the civil service law, in relation to suspension of employees of the department of parks in cities having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the parks department in cities with population million or more.

Items.MatterName: Suspension of employees of the department of correction.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan and Golden, S.5620, and Assembly Member Wright, A.8723, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to limiting assessment increases attributable to additions to or improvements of certain class two properties in the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Limiting assessment increases attributable to additons or improvements.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.4081-A, and Assembly Member Perry, A.1445-A, “AN ACT to amend the New York city charter, the vehicle and traffic law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the “open driveway act” regarding the environmental control board adjudication of disputes concerning the blocking of a driveway; and providing for the repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Open driveway act.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3972, and Assembly Members Abbate, Colton, Cymbrowitz, Pheffer, Seddio and Weisenberg, A.6381, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the employment of retired New York city police personnel”.
Items.MatterName: AN ACT, in relation to the employment of retired NYC police personnel.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senate Committee on Rules, S.5671, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8792, “AN ACT authorizing Lawrence Gerson to file for retroactive membership in Tier 1 of the New York state and local employees’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Tier one retroactive membership for Lawrence Gerson.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.2310, and Assembly Member Gianaris, A.8031, “AN ACT to amend the retirement and social security law, in relation to the optional age fifty-five improved benefit retirement program for certain New York city members”.
Items.MatterName: Optional age 55 improved benefit retirement program.

Items.MatterName: Impairments of health presumed accidental or incurred in the performance of duty.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5457-A, and Assembly Members Clark and Weprin, A.8421-A, “AN ACT to authorize the commissioner of general services to convey certain land in Queens county to the city of New York department of parks and recreation”.
Items.MatterName: Convey certain land in Queens to NYC Dept. of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Krueger, S.5706, and Assembly Member O’Donnell, A.8899, “AN ACT to amend the tax law and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reducing the general corporation, unincorporated business, and banking corporation tax rates”.
Items.MatterName: Reducing the general corp., unincorporated business and banking corp. tax rates.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan, Golden, Maltese and Marchi, S.5750, and Assembly Members McLaughlin, Farrell, Bing, Carrozza and Lavelle A.8896, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to the determination of adjusted base proportions in special assessing units which are cities for the fiscal year 2006”.
Items.MatterName: Property tax law, in relation to adusted base proportions.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5459-A, and Assembly Member Cymbrowitz, A.8375-A, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to increasing the earned income tax credit against the personal income tax for residents of a city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Increasing earned income tax credit.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5663, and the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.8813, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to exempting certain clothing and footwear sales and uses from local sales and compensating use taxes imposed in or by any city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Exempting certain clothing and footwear sales from taxes.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Golden, S.5465-A, and Assembly Members Wright, Benedetto, Benjamin, Boyland, Lavelle, O’Donnell, Pheffer, Rivera, and Colton, A.6590-B, “AN ACT to amend the real property tax law, in relation to increasing the combined household income limit for eligibility for senior citizen rent increase exemption (SCRIE) and for a municipal tax abatement for rent-controlled and rent regulated property occupied by senior citizens”.
Items.MatterName: Amend the real property tax law.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.3170, and Assembly Member Grannis, A.6483, “AN ACT to amend the highway law, in relation to liability of the state with respect to maintenance and repair of state arterial highways”.
Items.MatterName: Maintenance and repair of state arterial highways.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senators Padavan and Golden, S.5694, and Assembly Member Weprin, A.8861, “AN ACT to amend the general city law, chapter 772 of the laws of 1966 relating to enabling any city with a population of one million or more to raise tax revenue, and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the relocation and employment assistance program credit for companies in eligible growth industries”.
Items.MatterName: Companies in eligible growth industries.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Padavan, S.5382, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8779, “AN ACT to amend chapter 130 of the laws of 1998 amending the general municipal law relating to temporary investments by local governments, in relation to extending the expiration of the provisions thereof”.
Items.MatterName: Temporary investments by local governments, in relation to extending the expiration of the provisions thereof.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senators Duane, Andrews, Dilan, Hassell-Thompson, Krueger, Montgomery, Oppenheimer, Parker, Sabini, Sampson and Schneiderman, S.5157, “AN ACT to amend the general municipal law, the administrative code of the city of New York, the retirement and social security law and the education law, in relation to providing special accidental death benefits and accidental death benefits to registered domestic partners of deceased members of the New York city police pension fund, subchapter two, the New York city fire department pension fund, subchapter two, the New York city employees’ retirement system, the New York city teachers’ retirement system and the board of education retirement system of the city of New York”.
Items.MatterName: Providing special accidental death benefits  and accidental death benefits to registered domestic partners of deceased members of the NYC police pension fund,  subchapter two,  the NYC fire department pension fund.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Assembly Member Heastie, A.4407, “AN ACT authorizing the city of New York to discontinue the use as parkland a portion of real property in the borough of the Bronx and to use such property, as well as property under the jurisdiction of the city of New York department of transportation, for expansion and improvement of the Gun Hill Road subway station, in and around the intersection of White Plains Road and Gun Hill Road in exchange for the dedication of certain other land in the borough of the Bronx for park purposes”.
Items.MatterName: Expansion and improvement of the Gun Hill Road subway station.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5818, and the Assembly Committee on Rules, A.8932, “AN ACT authorizing the leasing of certain parkland and demapping of certain streets for development of a professional baseball stadium and associated facilities in and in the vicinity of Macombs Dam Park and John Mullaly Park in the borough of the Bronx in the city of New York, and to authorize the state to dispose of  certain surplus lands to the city of New  York to provide for new park facilities”.
Items.MatterName: Leasing of certain parkland and demapping of certain streets for development of a professional baseball stadium.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Saland, S.5823, “AN ACT to grant Anthony J. Cuomo performance of duty disability retirement benefits and health insurance coverage, as a result of injuries and disabilities incurred in action while serving in Iraq as a member of the Naval Reserve”.
Items.MatterName: Grant Anthony J. Cuomo performance of duty disability retirement benefits and health insurance coverage.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Paterson, S.5828, and Assembly Member Espaillat, A.8915, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, in relation to the extension of the top personal income tax rate for incomes in excess of five hundred thousand dollars a year or more and the dedication of such revenue to class size reduction in a city having a population of one million or more”.
Items.MatterName: Income tax rate for incomes in excess of five hundred thousand dollars.

Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Status of the electric power supply to City residents and businesses.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Marchi, S.5569, and Assembly Member Nolan, A.8434, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to conforming the unincorporated business tax to the general corporation tax with respect to the source of receipts from personal services and the inclusion of rented tangible personal property in the property allocation factor, and making formula allocation the preferred method for taxpayers subject to the unincorporated business tax, and allowing certain existing partnerships to continue to use the books and records allocation method for a seven-year period; makes technical corrections relating thereto; and to repeal certain provisions of such code relating to the unincorporated business pertaining to leveraged buy-out transactions”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Conforming the unicorporated tax to the general corporation tax.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5617, and Assembly Member Farrell, A.8780, “AN ACT to amend the tax law, the administrative code of the city of New York, chapter 877 of the laws of 1975, chapter 880 of the laws of 1975, chapter 884 of the laws of 1975, and chapter 882 of the laws of 1977, all relating to the imposition of certain taxes in the city of New York, in relation to postponing the expiration of certain tax rates and taxes in the city of New York”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Relating to the imposition of certain taxes in NYC.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by Senator Maltese, S.5596, and Assembly Member Nolan, A.8774, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to tax credits for eligible businesses that relocate to industrial business zones in the city of New York, the creation of an industrial business zone boundary commission, and the designation, amendment and repeal of such zones”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Industrial business zones.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass bills introduced by the Senate Committee on Rules, S.5672, and Assembly Member Abbate, A.8811, “AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the rate of regular interest used in the actuarial valuation of liabilities for the purpose of calculating contributions to the New York city employees’ retirement system, the New York city teachers’ retirement system, the police pension fund, subchapter two, the fire department pension fund, subchapter two and the board of education retirement system of such city by public employers and other obligors required to make employer contributions to such retirement systems, and the crediting of special interest and additional interest to members of such retirement systems, and the allowance of supplementary interest on the funds of such retirement systems”.
Items.ActionText: This SLR was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation
Items.MatterName: Calculating contributions to NYCERS.

Items.MinutesNote: At this point the Speaker (Council Member Miller) made the following annoucements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Miller), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Thursday, June 24, 2005.

VICTOR L. ROBLES, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council

Items.Title: Land Use Application - 920 Metcalf Avenue, Bronx, Community District 9
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Application be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.

Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. Gotbaum) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately: SLRs No. 118, 125 and 129.

See files for individual votes.
